page.title: 17R.A.F. FELTWELL TODAY
page.content: The base dates from World War One. It was used as an airfield till the end of World War Two. After that it was a training school for pilots. Then it was used for missiles. There is a street called Bird View Square because it was the best place to see the missiles. Today the base is a housing area for U.S. servicemen stationed at Lakenheath and Mildenhall. Nearly four hundred people live on the base. The old buildings now house schools for American children, hospital, furniture store, clinic and fire station. On the base the currency in use is dollars. Many other facilities for Americans away from home are available at Lakenheath, including shopping centre and even a newspaper called "Stars and Stripes"
